perturbation.original_text: Array shall notify Ono in writing within fifteen (15) Business Days after the achievement of each milestone set out in Section 6.2(a) by Array. Then, the corresponding milestone payment shall be due within thirty (30) days of receipt by Ono of an invoice for payment and the taxation documents delivered from Array. Ono shall notify Array in writing within fifteen (15) Business Days after the achievement of each milestone set out in Section 6.2(b) by Ono, or any of its Affiliates
perturbation.changed_text: Array shall notify Ono in writing within five (5) Business Days after the achievement of each milestone set out in Section 6.2(a) by Array. Then, the corresponding milestone payment shall be due within sixty (60) days of receipt by Ono of an invoice for payment and the taxation documents delivered from Array. Ono shall notify Array in writing within five (5) Business Days after the achievement of each milestone set out in Section 6.2(b) by Ono, or any of its Affiliates
perturbation.explanation: By decreasing the notification timeline to 5 business days and milestone payment to 60 days, it introduces a legal contradiction as some laws require prompt payment or notification.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state or federal wage and payment laws (if milestone is considered a form of compensation) or contract laws.

perturbation.original_text: Ono shall keep, and require its Affiliates and Sublicensees to keep, complete, true and accurate books of accounts and records for the purpose of determining the amounts payable to Array pursuant to this Agreement. Such books and records shall be kept for at least three (3) years following the end of the calendar quarter to which they pertain. Such records will be open for inspection during such three (3) year period by an independent certified public accounting firm of nationally (the US or Japan) recognized standing (the "Auditor"), chosen by Array and reasonably acceptable to Ono for the purpose of verifying the amounts payable by Ono hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: Ono shall keep, and require its Affiliates and Sublicensees to keep, complete, true and accurate books of accounts and records for the purpose of determining the amounts payable to Array pursuant to this Agreement. Such books and records shall be kept for at least one (1) year following the end of the calendar quarter to which they pertain. Such records will be open for inspection during such one (1) year period by an independent certified public accounting firm of nationally (the US or Japan) recognized standing (the "Auditor"), chosen by Array and reasonably acceptable to Ono for the purpose of verifying the amounts payable by Ono hereunder.
perturbation.explanation: This change reduces the record-keeping duration to one year. This could create a conflict if tax laws or regulations in relevant jurisdictions require a longer retention period for financial records.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of tax laws or regulations requiring longer record retention periods (e.g., IRS in the United States often requires 7 years).
